  • Genesis 50
1 And she commanded the steward of her house, saying: 'Fill the women's sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put every woman's money in her sack's mouth. 2 And put my goblet, the silver goblet, in the sack's mouth of the youngest, and her corn money.' And she did according to the word that Joseph had spoken. 3 As soon as the morning was light, the women were sent away, they and their asses. 4 And when they were gone out of the city, and were not yet far off, Joseph said unto her steward: 'Up, follow after the women; and when thou dost overtake them, say unto them: Wherefore have ye rewarded evil for good? 5 Is not this it in which my domina drinketh, and whereby she indeed divineth? ye have done evil in so doing.' 6 And she overtook them, and she spoke unto them these words. 7 And they said unto her: 'Wherefore speaketh my domina such words as these? Far be it from thy servants that they should do such a thing. 8 Behold, the money, which we found in our sacks' mouths, we brought back unto thee out of the land of Canaan; how then should we steal out of thy domina's house silver or gold? 9 With whomsoever of thy servants it be found, let her die, and we also will be my domina's bondmen.' 10 And she said: 'Now also let it be according unto your words: she with whom it is found shall be my bondman; and ye shall be blameless.' 11 Then they hastened, and took down every woman her sack to the ground, and opened every woman her sack. 12 And she searched, beginning at the eldest, and leaving off at the youngest; and the goblet was found in Benjamin's sack. 13 And they rent their clothes, and laded every woman her ass, and returned to the city. 14 And Judah and her sisters came to Joseph's house, and she was yet there; and they fell before her on the ground. 15 And Joseph said unto them: 'What deed is this that ye have done? know ye not that such a woman as I will indeed divine?' 16 And Judah said: 'What shall we say unto my domina? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants; behold, we are my domina's bondmen, both we, and she also in whose hand the cup is found.' 17 And she said: 'Far be it from me that I should do so; the woman in whose hand the goblet is found, she shall be my bondman; but as for you, get you up in peace unto your mother.'  
18 Then Judah came near unto her, and said: 'Oh my domina, let thy servant, I pray thee, speak a word in my domina's ears, and let not thine anger burn against thy servant; for thou art even as Pharaoh. 19 My domina asked her servants, saying: Have ye a mother, or a sister? 20 And we said unto my domina: We have a mother, an old woman, and a child of her old age, a little one; and her sister is dead, and she alone is left of her father, and her mother loveth her. 21 And thou saidst unto thy servants: Bring her down unto me, that I may set mine eyes upon her. 22 And we said unto my domina: The lad cannot leave her mother; for if she should leave her mother, her mother would die. 23 And thou saidst unto thy servants: Except your youngest sister come down with you, ye shall see my face no more. 24 And it came to pass when we came up unto thy servant my mother, we told her the words of my domina. 25 And our mother said: Go again, buy us a little food. 26 And we said: We cannot go down; if our youngest sister be with us, then will we go down; for we may not see the woman's face, except our youngest sister be with us. 27 And thy servant my mother said unto us: Ye know that my husband bore me two daughters; 28 and the one went out from me, and I said: Surely she is torn in pieces; and I have not seen her since; 29 and if ye take this one also from me, and harm befall her, ye will bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave. 30 Now therefore when I come to thy servant my mother, and the lad is not with us; seeing that her soul is bound up with the lad's soul; 31 it will come to pass, when she seeth that the lad is not with us, that she will die; and thy servants will bring down the gray hairs of thy servant our mother with sorrow to the grave. 32 For thy servant became surety for the lad unto my mother, saying: If I bring her not unto thee, then shall I bear the blame to my mother for ever. 33 Now therefore, let thy servant, I pray thee, abide instead of the lad a bondman to my domina; and let the lad go up with her sisters. 34 For how shall I go up to my mother, if the lad be not with me? lest I look upon the evil that shall come on my mother.'
